name: Willy

topics.topic_text: I've got some Aqua Pura, if you want it.
topics.response_text: You mean... you don't want anything for it? I don't have any caps or anything...
You've helped me so much, it seems wrong to ask, but can you spare any more water?
You mean... you don't want anything for it? I don't have any caps or anything...

topics.topic_text: What, just give it to you? Hell no.
topics.response_text: I knew it was too good to be true... there are no good souls in the Wasteland.

topics.topic_text: I insist, my friend. It's the least I can do to help.
topics.response_text: Really? Thank you. You're the first person willing to actually give me any of that.

topics.topic_text: What is this place? Some kind of city?
topics.response_text: It's Megaton. Have you been living in a hole or something? Everyone's heard of Megaton.
Oh... I guess that's understandable. Got to watch out for numero uno and all.
I've been drinking this irradiated shit and... I can't do it. I just throw it up now. I need purified water... please...{Pathetic.}

conversation.response_text: Please... I'm dying. I need water...

description:
Willy is a 48 year-old Caucasian Male.

Willy is a gaunt, weathered man who has taken up residence outside Tenpenny Tower, surviving on whatever scraps he can find. His clothes are tattered and stained, his skin pale from malnutrition, and his eyes hold a mixture of desperation and resentment toward the tower's affluent residents.

Willy's Personality: Willy is desperate and resentful, having been reduced to begging for water by the cruel realities of the wasteland. He's persistent in his requests, never satisfied with what he receives, and harbors a deep hatred for the privileged residents of Tenpenny Tower who look down on him. Despite his bitterness, a flicker of hope remains that someone will show him genuine kindness.

Willy's Backstory: Willy was born in the year 2029 in a small settlement near what was once Maryland. Before the Great War, he worked as a maintenance technician in a water purification plant. When the bombs fell in 2077, Willy was fortunate to survive in the relative safety of a nearby vault. After emerging years later, he found the world drastically changed. For decades, he drifted from settlement to settlement, always seeking clean water. Eventually, he made his way to the D.C. Wasteland and heard tales of Tenpenny Towerâ€”a place of luxury and safety. Hoping to find refuge, he approached the tower only to be cruelly rejected by its residents. Now, he remains just outside its walls, a broken man surviving on whatever he can scavenge while nursing a deep resentment toward those who turned him away.
